author: Callie C
title: Our favourite place to stay in Manhattan
text:
This was a lucky find back in 2003, when we first stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel, and is where we tend to stay on return trips (room availability allowing).
There is something quite magical about The Roosevelt Hotel in the run-up to Christmas: the main foyer is home to a magnificent Christmas tree, bedecked in finery. Sitting in the bar having a warming alcoholic hot-chocolate after a hard day of shopping and sightseeing is the perfect soothing balm to your soul!
The location is pretty good: close to Grand Central Station and all the main tourist locations, such as Times Square and Fifth Avenue are within easy walking distance.
Room quality is ok for Manhattan - not huge, but not shoebox size. Some of the rooms could do with updating but the main thing is they are clean and the beds are very comfortable.
Admittedly we've never eaten at the hotel apart from having breakfast a couple of times in the bar area, which was reasonably-priced and adequate.
Wifi is available in the hotel.
